item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Svader – Create GPU-rendered Svelte components (4 points | discuss)
2. I made a free Figma library packed with components for fast prototyping (24 points | 8 comments)
3. Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens (67 points | 12 comments)
4. What Is Entropy? A Measure of Just How Little We Know (36 points | 12 comments)
5. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (251 points | 42 comments)
6. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (80 points | 7 comments)
7. Luon programming language (144 points | 54 comments)
8. Show HN: Performant intracontinental public transport routing in Rust (87 points | 14 comments)
9. Graphene Interconnects Aim to Give Moore's Law New Life (25 points | 10 comments)
10. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (196 points | 49 comments)
11. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (157 points | 32 comments)
12. Making my first robot as a software engineer (276 points | 51 comments)
13. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (161 points | 60 comments)
14. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (169 points | 19 comments)
15. Donald Bitzer has died (185 points | 19 comments)
16. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (169 points | 26 comments)
17. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (195 points | 125 comments)
18. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (121 points | 41 comments)
19. Suchir's Essay on Fair Use (30 points | 2 comments)
20. Idiomatic Errors in Clojure (44 points | 9 comments)
21. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (394 points | 192 comments)
22. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (661 points | 242 comments)
23. McKinsey and Company to pay $650M for role in opioid crisis (295 points | 177 comments)
24. The science of routing print orders (5 points | discuss)
25. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (109 points | 38 comments)
26. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (86 points | 27 comments)
27. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (191 points | 53 comments)
28. Test (521 points | 124 comments)
29. Sequence to sequence learning with neural networks: what a decade [video] (45 points | 19 comments)
30. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (1132 points | 166 comments)
